text: Curious Crawlers
What Is A Bug?: A Journey into the Unknown
The word ‘bugs’ means any small, creepy-crawlies like spiders or worms.
It also includes insects like bees and crickets.
Have you ever come across strange bugs?
Did you feel curious and stare at them closely?
Or did you get scared and scream?
Insects usually have three main body parts.
They called a head, a thorax, and an abdomen.
Insects have three pairs of legs.
Insects have two antennae on their heads.
Some insects even hear with them.
Bugs are the most important creatures on Earth.
Without them, many plants and animals would also disappear.
Are you ready to meet the bugs?
Let’s go on an adventure!

Curious Crawlers!
Who Would Win?: Bugs Beyond Belief
This beetle can weigh up to 100 grams.
The Goliath Beetle is the largest insect on Earth.
It is found in the tropical forests of Africa.
It weighs more than a sparrow.
The Giant Weta is local to New Zealand.
It is one of the heaviest insects in the world.
The Atlas Moth is the largest in the world.
But it is more famous for its wing pattern.
Its wing patterns look like snake heads.
This can scare away predators.
The Hercules Beetle has enormous strength.
It can lift objects 850 times its weight.
The Bombardier Beetle is famous for its defense flair.
It can eject a hot chemical spray.

Weird Or Wonderful?: The Secret Lives of Bugs
The Praying Mantis is famous for its posture.
Look at it holding its forelegs together.
They are in a praying position.
But it’s a great hunter.
Stick Insects look like twigs and branches.
Let’s meet Leaf Insects and Stick Insects.
Why do they look like that?
It is easy to hide.
So it is hard to spot them in nature.
The Peacock Spider captures our attention.
It displays gorgeous colors.
The Peacock Spider is named due to the male's appearance.
And it shows comical courtship dance.
What kind of cute action do you like?
